column5: So it looks like I need this card to operate my boat in Canada for my trip up there in a few months(I live in the States) Having a heck of a time finding the aplpication. Can some one provide the link for the application form? Thanks
Are you going to be there more than 45 days in a row? If not, you don't need it. Scott

Get your pleasure craft operator card through your own state (Minnesota). Here is a link to the info. you'll need. http://files.dnr.state.mn.us/recreat...an_boating.pdfIt will cost you half the price of the Canadian card and is legal here. It used to be free but now it will cost you $20.00 to take the course online.
I'm only in Canada for a week at a time. So I don't need any certification then?
no you do NOT need any certification is only going a week at a time.
NOPE... That law is only applied to us Canadians...nice $50.00 money grab that's it. It's not even a licence actually.
www.boatsmartexam.com - offers the Pleasure Craft Operator Card and if you like their facebook page you'll get $10 off the exam www.facebook.com/boatsmart

We are thinking of just getting one to say we have it. We use our own boat in canada and we are only up there for 8 days but thinking it may be wise to have it just for when they possibly may make it a law a law for everyone.Will this one work for Canada also?http://www.boat-ed.com/Iowa/index.ht...FRFoKgodxRksxg

"Boating license: You may take the test on line in your home State and it will be recognized in Canada, go to licensingand take the exam. If you haven't had a chance to get the boater's license, you can do a rental boat safety checklist at the Outpost Camp. The fine for not having either is $250, only the boat operator needs to have a license or rental boat safety checklist with them at all times."This was taken from this website below.http://www.thousandlakesoutposts.com...Trip_Planning/

Ya know what's funny about the whole thing is that anyone can get one of these with NO knowledge of the water at all. Most people cheat by having 2 computers open or even have someone else take the test for them. It's a pure money grab, and in all the years I've been fishing/boating I've never once been asked to see my operators card....not once.
